```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
set.seed(10)

data_table = tibble(
  my_variable = rnorm(10),
  logical_vec = my_variable > 0,
  ten_char_vector = c("c", "h", "a", "r", "a", "c", "t", "e", "r", "s"),
  three_levels = factor(c("one", "two", "three", "three", "two", "one", "one", "one", "three", "three"))
)

mean(pull(data_table,my_variable))
mean(pull(data_table,ten_char_vector))
mean(pull(data_table,three_levels))

```

The random sample size 10 from a standard normal distribution works because it is quantitative data, while the character vector of length 10 and factor vector of length 10 do not work because they contain qualitative data.
